skill.name: pyopenms
skill.description: Complete mass spectrometry analysis platform. Use for proteomics workflows feature detection, peptide identification, protein quantification, and complex LC-MS/MS pipelines. Supports extensive file formats and algorithms. Best for proteomics, comprehensive MS data processing. For simple spectral comparison and metabolite ID use matchms.
skill.summary: Complete mass spectrometry analysis platform. Use for proteomics workflows feature detection, peptid...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files with Python code examples. The static analyzer incorrectly flagged markdown syntax patterns as security threats. All 295 static findings are false positives. No executable code exists in this skill.

content.value_statement: Process proteomics and metabolomics data with comprehensive mass spectrometry tools. This skill provides access to OpenMS algorithms for file format handling, spectral processing, feature detection, and peptide identification workflows.
actual_capabilities: Read and write mass spectrometry file formats including mzML, mzXML, and idXML
Process raw spectral data with smoothing, filtering, and normalization algorithms
Detect and link features across spectra for quantitative analysis
Perform peptide and protein identification with FDR filtering
Export data to pandas DataFrames for downstream analysis
Handle FASTA sequence files and TraML transition lists
limitations: Requires pyopenms package installation which has complex dependencies
Does not include search engine binaries (Comet, Mascot, MSGFPlus must be installed separately)
Limited to documented OpenMS functionality, no custom algorithm extension

use_cases.title: Quantitative proteomics
use_cases.description: Process LC-MS/MS datasets to identify and quantify proteins across multiple samples

use_cases.title: Pipeline development
use_cases.description: Build automated mass spectrometry data processing pipelines with Python

use_cases.title: Metabolite analysis
use_cases.description: Perform untargeted metabolomics preprocessing and feature annotation

prompt_templates.title: Basic file loading
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I load an mzML file and access the spectra and chromatograms using pyopenms?

prompt_templates.title: Feature detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to detect features in centroided mass spectrometry data using the FeatureFinder in pyopenms.

prompt_templates.title: Peptide identification
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I load identification results from an idXML file and apply false discovery rate filtering in pyopenms?

prompt_templates.title: Advanced workflows
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete pyopenms workflow that loads mzML data, processes spectra, detects features, and exports results to a pandas DataFrame.

output_examples.input: Load an mzML file and show me the first spectrum
output: Use MSExperiment to hold the data and MzMLFile to load it
Access spectra via iteration or getSpectrum(index) method
Extract m/z and intensity values with get_peaks() which returns numpy arrays
Get metadata like MS level and retention time with getMSLevel() and getRT()

output_examples.input: How do I apply signal processing to my spectra?
output: Use GaussFilter or SavitzkyGolayFilter for smoothing
Set parameters with getParameters() and setValue()
Consider normalization with LinearNormalizer before processing

best_practices: Use IndexedMzMLFileLoader for large files to avoid loading entire dataset into memory
Apply appropriate signal processing (smoothing, filtering) before feature detection
Validate file existence with os.path.exists() before loading data
anti_patterns: Loading very large mzML files entirely into memory without using streaming or indexed access
Skipping quality control steps before downstream analysis
Ignoring instrument metadata that may affect data interpretation

faq.question: What file formats does pyopenms support?
faq.answer: mzML, mzXML, mzData, idXML, mzIdentML, pepXML, protXML, featureXML, consensusXML, mzTab, FASTA, and TraML.

faq.question: How do I install pyopenms?
faq.answer: Use uv: uv pip install pyopenms. Requires Python 3.8+ and has C++ dependency requirements.

faq.question: Can pyopenms run without OpenMS installed?
faq.answer: No, pyopenms is a Python wrapper around the OpenMS C++ library which must be available on the system.

faq.question: Does pyopenms include search engines?
faq.answer: No, pyopenms integrates with search engines but you must install them separately (Comet, Mascot, MSGFPlus, etc.).

faq.question: How do I export data to pandas?
faq.answer: Use the get_df() method on FeatureMap, ConsensusMap, or other data containers to export directly to DataFrames.

faq.question: What is the difference between pyopenms and matchms?
faq.answer: pyopenms is comprehensive for proteomics workflows. Use matchms for simple spectral comparison and metabolite identification.
